clinical_study.official_title: Targeted Injury Prevention Program: Preventing Falls Among Older Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness of a best practice model for senior falls prevention when implemented in a community setting.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the incidence of falls, reported once a month over a one year follow-up period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in lower body strength, balance and mobility measured at baseline and repeated at the end of a one year follow-up period.
